result.execSummary:
The court found certain circumstances that required this case be transferred to the jurisdiction of the Juvenile Court. When a juvenile is charged in a court of criminal jurisdiction, the court can transfer the case to the jurisdiction of the juvenile court if the court finds all of the following: 1) If convicted, the juvenile could not receive adequate treatment in the criminal justice system; 2) Transferring jurisdiction to the court assigned to exercise juvenile jurisdiction would not depreciate the seriousness of the offense; and 3) Retaining jurisdiction is not necessary to deter the juvenile or other juveniles from committing the violation of which the juvenile is accused.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order on Motion to Seal or Redact a Court Record filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)
Motion to Seal or Redact a Court Record filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)
Original Adult Court Jurisdiction Order /s/ MDZ 11/02/22
Original Adult Court Jurisdiction Order filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)

4:02 PM Defendant Darius A Polar appeared by video from Northwest Passage.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Darius A Polar.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Pfeil calls the case and states the appearances.
This is set for a contested Preliminary Hearing.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via video ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.

4:05 p.m.  Deputy C Hawkins is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
4:08 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
4:11 p.m.  Atty Renc has no questions.
Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil has no further witnesses or evidence.
Atty Renc has no witnesses or evidence.
Neither party has final argument.
Court is aware if the reverse waiver motion in the court file.
ADA Pfeil states that they wish to address it at today's hearing.
Court questions if Human Services needs to be involved.
ADA Pfeil makes further statement with regards to contact with Human Services.
State is not opposed to the reverse waiver and has no evidence to contest this waiver.
Court questions the State with regards to the delinquency petition and where to file it and if he will follow up with Human Services.
State will make sure that a juvenile delinquency referral will be made. 
Atty Renc indicates that she has filed the order prior to today's hearing.
Atty Renc would put in a request to redact the juveniles name.
State is in compliance with victim rights requirements and no victims appear for today's hearing.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Reverse Waiver Motion is GRANTED.
Proposed Order is to be filed by Atty Renc.

4:18 p.m.  Case is adjourned.
Memorandum in Support of Reverse Waiver filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/28/22 sp)
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Motion to Transfer Jurisdiction to Juvenile Court Under 970.032(2) filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/11/22 sp)

No additional conditions
No contact with T.L.D., outside of a correctional type institution

2:35 PM Defendant Darius A Polar appeared by video.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Darius A Polar.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $150 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Renc has no objection to the signature bond.
State is in compliance with victim rights requirements.
Atty Renc makes statements with regards to the conditions.
Atty Renc states that the defendant is going to be transferred to Northeast Passage.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Renc.
